p.ui:msg: OPEN ONLY TO INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE FULL-TIME STUDENTS AND WHO OTHERWISE MEET THE ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA. VOID WHERE PROHIBITED.

Note - the Finalists of this Contest will be asked to travel to Beijing, China in December 2013. If you cannot travel at that time, please do not enter this Contest. If a Finalist is selected who cannot travel on these dates, the Sponsor will select an alternative Finalist.

NO PURCHASE NECESSARY TO ENTER OR WIN. Red Hat Asia Pacific Pte Ltd ("Sponsor") is sponsoring the 2013 Red Hat Challenge ("Contest"), a skill contest in which participants compete to receive the Prize (defined below) by demonstrating their Linux skill through various Red Hat Linux System Administration, Network Administration, Security Administration and Virtualization tasks. The Contest begins on 23 October 2013 at 9.00am Singapore Time ("SGT") and ends on 14 December 2012 at 6.00pm SGT ("Term"). VOID WHERE PROHIBITED.

To be eligible to enter the Contest, you must be: (1) a full-time student currently attending a university, polytechnic institution or private school; (2) a legal resident of China, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Singapore, Taiwan, or Thailand ("Eligible Countries"); and (3) above the age of majority in your country, province, and/or state of legal residence at the time of entry or at least twenty years of age in Taiwan (“Participant”). You must also have access to the Internet and a valid student email address to enter the Contest. You will also be required to provide the name of a lecturer contact from your school ("sponsor lecturer") so that Sponsor can obtain information about the school. Employees, officers, and directors of Red Hat, Inc., its subsidiaries and affiliated companies, Red Hat partners, distributors, system integrators and independent software vendors, and their immediate families and those living in their households are not eligible to enter. Government employees and contractors are not eligible to enter. The top three (3) Finalists from the 2012 Red Hat Challenge are not eligible to enter.

If you are entering as part of a company or on behalf of your employer, these rules are binding on you, individually, and/or your employer. If you are acting within the scope of your employment, as an employee, contractor, or agent of another party, you warrant that such party has full knowledge of your actions and has consented thereto, including your potential receipt of a Prize. You further warrant that your actions do not violate your employer's or company's policies and procedures.

LIMIT ONE (1) ENTRY PER PERSON. Subsequent entries will be disqualified. All Entries become the property of Sponsor and will not be returned or acknowledged. Entries are void if they are in whole or part illegible, incomplete, damaged, altered, counterfeit, manipulated or obtained through fraud. Sponsor is not responsible for lost, late, misdirected, mutilated, incomplete, or illegible entries or email, or for any computer related, online, telephonic, or technical malfunctions that may occur, regardless of whether or not such occurrences are within Sponsor's control.

To enter, you must provide personal information in order for Red Hat to process your contest application. Your personal information will be transferred to servers located in the U.S. By registering for the Contest, you consent to the transfer of your personal information to servers in the U.S. Further, you agree to be bound by Sponsor's privacy policy located at: www.redhat.com/legal/privacy_statement.html and you understand that your personal information will be used in accordance with this policy.
Red Hat Asia Pacific Pte Ltd, located at 8 Shenton Way #10-00 Singapore 068811, is the sponsor of the Contest.

Judging will occur in three rounds. In the First Round, twenty (20) Contestants from each Eligible Country will be selected (the "Semi-Finalists"). In the Second Round, six (6) Semi-Finalists from China and two (2) Semi-Finalists from each other Eligible Country will be selected (the “Finalists”). In the Final Round, one (1) winner will be selected from among the sixteen (16) Finalists to receive the Prize (the “Winner”).

The First Round of the Contest will take place on 23 and 24 October 2013 (“First Round”). The First Round consists of an online, multiple-choice test ("Test"). Contestants have one hour to complete the Test.

Twenty (20) Semi-Finalists will be selected from China, twenty (20) Semi-Finalists will be selected from Hong Kong, twenty (20) Semi-Finalists will be selected from Malaysia, twenty (20) Semi-Finalists will be selected from Singapore, twenty (20) Semi-Finalists will be selected from Taiwan, and twenty (20) Semi-Finalists will be selected from Thailand for a total of 120 Semi-Finalists overall. In the event of a tie for twentieth place, the Contestant who completed the Test in the shortest amount of time will advance to the Second Round of judging as a potential semi-finalist. In the event of a further tie for twentieth place, all tied Contestants with the highest Test score and identical times for completion of the Test will advance to the Second Round of judging. The Contestants selected as potential semi-finalists will be notified by e-mail that they have been selected as potential semi-finalists in the Contest on or about 5 November 2013. If the e-mail notification is ignored or returned as undeliverable, the potential semi-finalist will be disqualified.

The Second Round of judging will take place between 11 November 2012 and 15 November 2013 ("Second Round"). The Second Round consists of an interview between Semi-Finalist and a Red Hat certified instructor or examiner, during which Semi-Finalist will be tasked to provide solutions to problems faced in a Linux/Virtualization environment ("Interview"). The Interview will be held in person at the Red Hat office closest to Semi-Finalist's residence. Alternatively, the interview may take place via video conference.
In the Second Round, Semi-Finalists will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

Each Semi-Finalist will be given (three) 3 problems - one Simple Level 1 problem, one Intermediate Level 2 problem and one Advance Level 3 problem in a Linux/Virtualization environment. The Semi-Finalist will have thirty (30) minutes to answer as many of these problems as possible. Solutions provided by each Semi-finalist to the three (3) problems will be scored.

The six (6) Semi-Finalists from China who receive the highest scores during the Second Round, and the two (2) Semi-Finalists from each of the other Eligible Countries who receive the highest scores during the Second Round, will be selected to proceed to the Final Round, for a total of sixteen (16) Finalists overall. In order to qualify to move on to the Final Round, a Semi-Finalist must receive a minimum score of 50% during Round Two. In the event of a tie, of the tied Semi-Finalists the one who completed the First Round Test in the shortest amount of time will advance to the Final Round of judging as a potential finalist. The Semi-Finalists selected as potential finalists will be notified by e-mail that they have been selected as potential finalists in the Contest on or about 21 November 2012. Except where prohibited by law, the potential finalists may be asked to sign an Affidavit of Eligibility, Release of Liability and/or Publicity Release (“Affidavit”). If an Affidavit is provided to a potential finalist, the potential finalist must fully execute and return the Affidavit within five (5) days of attempted notification by Sponsor in order to proceed to the Final Round of judging. If the e-mail notification is ignored or returned as undeliverable, or the Sponsor does not timely receive the Affidavit when asked to provide it, the potential finalist will be disqualified and an alternate potential finalist will be selected based on the Second Round evaluation criteria listed herein. If a potential finalist is unable to travel to Beijing, China for the Final Round, that potential finalists will be disqualified and an alternate potential finalist will be selected based on the second Round evaluation criteria listed herein.

The final round of judging will take place on 14 December 2013 (“Final Round”). The Final Round will be held in Beijing, China. The Finalists will travel to Beijing, China, where they will compete against one another in a live Red Hat environment ("Live Competition").

During the Live Competition, Finalists will receive points for completing tasks correctly within the allocated time. The Finalist with the most points at the end of the Live Competition will be the Winner. In the event of a tie, the Finalist who completed all of the tasks within the shortest amount of time will be the Winner.

Sponsor will provide the Finalists from Hong Kong, Malaysia, Singapore, Taiwan, and Thailand with round-trip airfare to, and lodging and accommodations for one (1) day in Beijing, China. The Finalists from China will be provided round-trip train ticket and accommodations for one (1) day in Beijing, China if the candidate is not living in Beijing. Finalists are responsible for all required travel documents, including Passports and/or Visa requirements. Finalists are responsible for obtaining all forms of insurance including, but not limited to, travel insurance, and Finalists acknowledge that Sponsor has no obligation to obtain or provide travel insurance or any other form of insurance.
Winner will receive one (1) Samsung Galaxy S4 smartphone with an Approximate Retail Value ("ARV") of RMB4688 ("Prize").
